metadata.feature_description: Bookmark and unbookmark articles for later reference

steps.expected: Wiki page loads with article list
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded showing 6 articles in the 'All Articles' list

steps.action: Click on article link to view article details
steps.expected: Article detail page opens with bookmark button visible
steps.actual: Article URLs return 404 error - page not found. All article links (Test Article Draft, Test Article for Bookmarks, etc.) lead to 404 error page

issues: All Wiki article URLs return 404 error - cannot access article detail view where bookmark button is located
Article pages are not accessible despite articles appearing in the listing

steps.action: Attempt to access article detail page to find unbookmark button
steps.expected: Article detail page with unbookmark button available
steps.actual: Cannot access article detail page due to 404 errors - unbookmark button is inaccessible

issues: Cannot test unbookmark functionality because article detail pages are inaccessible (404 errors)

steps.action: Look for bookmarked articles view or filter
steps.expected: UI element to view bookmarked articles
steps.actual: The Wiki module list view shows 'All Articles' and 'My Articles' tabs, but no dedicated 'Bookmarked Articles' view was found in the UI

issues: No dedicated 'Bookmarked Articles' filter or view found in the Wiki module UI
Based on code review (Article.ascx), bookmark functionality exists but requires accessing individual article pages which return 404 errors

steps.expected: Bookmarked article remains bookmarked across sessions
steps.actual: Cannot test - article detail pages are inaccessible due to 404 errors

issues: Cannot verify bookmark persistence because article detail pages return 404 errors

observations: Code review confirms bookmark functionality exists in the codebase: dnn.wiki.Article.js has bookmark() and unbookmark() methods, Article.ascx has UI elements with dnnSocialBookmark class, and SocialController.cs has Bookmark/Unbookmark endpoints
The bookmark button appears in the article detail view based on Article.ascx (lines 39-44) which shows bookmark icon with conditional rendering based on model.bookmarked state
All existing Wiki article URLs return 404 errors - this appears to be a routing or configuration issue preventing access to article detail pages
Article creation dialog appears to have issues - Publish button clicks are not submitting the form
The Wiki module listing page works correctly showing articles, but individual article pages are not accessible
Based on Mechanics.cs (line 56), bookmark actions are defined with 0 reputation/experience points: AddScoringAction(Constants.ScoringActions.BookmarkedArticle, 0, 0, ActionTypes.FormedRelationship)
